item.title: CDK 网络故障连续第二天袭击美国汽车经销商
item.description: 受影响的公司周四表示，零售技术和软件供应商 CDK 的网络中断已进入连续第二天，影响到了全美的汽车经销商。【原文：A cyber outage at retail technology and software provider CDK entered its second consecutive day on Thursday, impacting automobile dealers across the United States, the affected companies said on Thursday.】

item.title: 波兰人民党称警方正在调查 "兴登堡研究 "案
item.description: 时装集团 LPP 周四表示，波兰警方已开始调查兴登堡研究公司可能操纵金融工具的行为。【原文：Polish police have opened an investigation into possible manipulation of financial instruments by Hindenburg Research, fashion group LPP said on Thursday.】

item.title: 阿波罗全球首席经济学家预计美联储今年不会减息
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）首席经济学家表示，美国联邦储备委员会今年不太可能降息，因为更宽松的金融条件将抵消借贷成本的影响，保持通胀稳定和经济弹性。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve is unlikely to cut interest rates this year as easier financial conditions will offset the impact of borrowing costs by keeping inflation sticky and the economy resilient, the chief economist of Apollo Global Management said.】

item.title: 据《财富》报道，美国商品期货交易委员会正在调查 Jump Trading 参与加密货币交易的情况
item.description: 财富》周四援引一位熟悉此事的人士的话报道称，美国商品期货交易委员会（CFTC）正在调查 Jump Trading 在加密货币领域的参与情况。【原文：The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) is probing Jump Trading's involvement in the cryptocurrency space, Fortune reported on Thursday, citing a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: TikTok 称，如果没有法院命令阻止法律，美国的禁令将不可避免
item.description: TikTok和中国母公司字节跳动周四敦促美国法院取消一项他们认为将于1月19日在美国禁用这一流行短应用程序的法律，并称美国政府拒绝在2022年后进行任何严肃的和解谈判。【原文：TikTok and Chinese parent ByteDance on Thursday urged a U.S. court to strike down a law they say will ban the popular short app in the United States on Jan. 19, saying the U.S. government refused to engage in any serious settlement talks after 2022.】

item.title: 甲骨文将在西班牙投资超过 10 亿美元用于人工智能和云计算
item.description: 甲骨文公司周四表示，未来10年将在西班牙的人工智能和云计算领域投资超过10亿美元，以满足该国日益增长的服务需求。【原文：Oracle on Thursday said it will invest more than $1 billion over the next 10 years in artificial intelligence and cloud computing in Spain, as it looks to meet increasing demand for its services in the country.】

item.title: 美国大银行面临的非银行外溢风险越来越大
item.description: 美联储周四在其自由街经济学博客上发表文章称，非银行金融机构对美国的大银行构成的风险越来越大。【原文：Non-bank financial institutions pose an increasing risk to America's big banks, the Federal Reserve said on Thursday in a post on the Fed's Liberty Street Economics blog.】

item.title: Coinbase 针对美国拉丁裔选民投放价值 200 万美元的广告
item.description: Coinbase 公司周四向路透社透露，该公司针对拉美裔选民发起了一场耗资 200 万美元的广告宣传活动，因为加密货币行业在本轮美国大选中采取行动，将友好的立法者推选上台。【原文：Coinbase launched on Thursday a $2 million ad campaign targeted toward Latino voters, the company told Reuters, as the crypto industry makes moves this U.S. election cycle to put friendly lawmakers into office.】

item.title: 英国市场因降息希望和大选喧嚣而重获生机
item.description: 尽管英国央行周四将利率维持在 16 年来的高位，但交易员们还是提高了对英国央行 8 月份降息的押注，这有助于支撑英国股市和政府债券在大选前的反弹。【原文：Traders upped bets for a Bank of England rate cut in August, helping to underpin a pre-election rally for UK stocks and government bonds even though the central bank left rates on hold at a 16-year high on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国敦促英国选择股市震荡日期
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会主席加里-根斯勒（Gary Gensler）周四表示，英国应确定一个日期，将股票交易的结算时间减半，并坚持下去。【原文：Britain should set a date for halving the time it takes to settle a stock trade - and stick with it, U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国最高法院不会颠覆对美国人海外收入征税的做法
item.description: 美国最高法院周四作出裁决，驳回了对投资于某些外国公司的美国人征税的质疑，作出这一裁决正值一些民主党议员寻求对超级富豪征收财富税之际。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court on Thursday ruled against a challenge to a tax on Americans who have invested in certain foreign corporations, issuing the decision at a time when some Democratic lawmakers are seeking to impose a wealth tax on the super rich.】

item.title: Anthropic 推出最新人工智能模型，距上一款模型已过去三个月
item.description: 由谷歌（Google）和亚马逊（Amazon.com）支持的初创公司Anthropic周四发布了更新的人工智能模型和新的布局，以提高用户的工作效率，继续在行业内冲刺技术前沿。【原文：Anthropic, a startup backed by Google and Amazon.com , on Thursday released an updated artificial intelligence model and a new layout to boost user productivity, continuing an industry sprint to push technology's frontier.】

item.title: 尼古拉计划进行 1 对 30 的反向股票分割，以符合纳斯达克上市规则
item.description: 尼古拉公司周四宣布进行 1 对 30 的反向股票分割，以符合纳斯达克上市规则。【原文：Nikola on Thursday announced a 1-for-30 reverse stock split to comply with Nasdaq listing rules.】

item.title: 汇丰任命高盛资深人士为机构客户部全球主管
item.description: 汇丰银行（HSBC）周四表示，已任命高盛（Goldman Sachs）资深员工丹妮尔-约翰逊（Danielle Johnson）从 6 月 3 日起担任全球银行与市场业务机构客户部全球主管。【原文：HSBC said on Thursday it had appointed Goldman Sachs veteran Danielle Johnson as the global head of its institutional client group within the global banking and markets business, effective June 3.】

item.title: 美国 5 月独户住宅开工率下降
item.description: 由于抵押贷款利率居高不下，5 月份美国单户住宅建筑量有所下降。【原文：U.S. single-family homebuilding fell in May amid continued high mortgage rates.】

item.title: 租车公司赫兹计划通过票据融资 7.5 亿美元
item.description: 赫兹全球控股公司（Hertz Global Holdings）周四表示，该公司打算通过发行有担保票据融资 7.5 亿美元，因为在押注电动汽车失败后，该公司希望加强其资产负债表。【原文：Hertz Global Holdings said on Thursday it intends to raise $750 million through secured notes offerings, as it looks to shore up its balance sheet after a failed bet on electric vehicles.】

item.title: 麦当劳下周推出 5 美元套餐，快餐连锁店向节俭型顾客招手
item.description: 汉堡巨头麦当劳周四表示，该公司将从 6 月 25 日起在全美部分餐厅限时推出 5 美元套餐优惠。【原文：McDonald's will roll out its $5 meal deal from June 25 for a limited time at some restaurants across the U.S., the burger giant said on Thursday, as fast-food chains ramp up cost-friendly options to boost spending among lower-income groups.】

item.title: 美国最近一周每周申请失业救济人数下降
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数量有所下降，但尽管就业市场逐渐降温，整体仍保持强劲。【原文：The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits fell last week, but overall strength in the jobs market persisted despite a gradual cooling.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称拜登将因与俄罗斯的关系禁止在美国销售卡巴斯基软件
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士称，拜登政府将于周四宣布禁止在美国销售卡巴斯基实验室的杀毒软件的计划，并列举了该公司在美国的大客户，包括关键基础设施提供商以及州和地方政府。【原文：The Biden administration on Thursday will announce plans to bar the sale of Kaspersky Lab's antivirus software in the United States, a person familiar with the matter said, citing the firm's large U.S. customers including critical infrastructure providers and state and local governments.】

item.title: Castlelake 将从 Upstart 收购高达 12 亿美元的消费贷款
item.description: 私人信用贷款公司 Castlelake 周四表示，将从金融科技公司 Upstart 收购高达 12 亿美元的消费分期贷款，以扩大其在零售贷款领域的立足点。【原文：Private credit lender Castlelake will buy up to $1.2 billion in consumer installment loans from fintech firm Upstart to expand its foothold in the retail lending space, it said on Thursday.】

item.title: 由于杂货需求稳定，克罗格第一季度同店销售额超出预期
item.description: 克罗格公司（Kroger）周四的季度同店销售额超出华尔街预期，这得益于更多顾客涌入其门店购买价格较低的食品杂货，因为通胀严重制约了家庭预算。【原文：Kroger beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly same-store sales on Thursday, benefiting from more customers thronging to its outlets for lower-priced groceries as sticky inflation stretches household budgets.】

item.title: PayPal 聘请沃尔玛高管担任首席技术官，推动人工智能发展
item.description: PayPal 周四告诉路透社，该公司已聘请沃尔玛的一位顶级技术高管 Srini Venkatesan 担任新的首席技术官，负责公司在人工智能领域的推进工作。【原文：PayPal has hired one of Walmart's top tech executives Srini Venkatesan to head up the company's push into artificial intelligence as its new chief technology officer, the company told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 英伟达将巩固全球最有价值公司地位
item.description: 在合作伙伴戴尔公司和超微计算机公司收到埃隆-马斯克的人工智能初创公司的服务器订单后，英伟达股价在周四收盘前上涨了 3%，将扩大这家半导体风向标公司作为全球最有价值公司的领先地位。【原文：Nvidia shares gained 3% before the bell on Thursday, set to extend the semiconductor bellwether's lead as the world's most valuable company, after partners Dell and Super Micro Computer received server orders for Elon Musk's AI startup.】

item.title: 英国大选前，英格兰银行将利率维持在 16 年高位
item.description: 英国央行在 7 月 4 日英国大选前的最后一次会议上将其主要利率维持在 5.25% 的 16 年高位不变，但未来降息的前景更加接近，因为一些决策者表示他们的想法现在已经 "微妙平衡"。【原文：The Bank of England kept its main interest rate unchanged at a 16-year high of 5.25% at its last meeting before July 4's UK election, but the prospect of a future rate cut moved closer as some policymakers said their thinking was now "finely balanced".】

item.title: 英格兰银行在英国大选前将利率维持在 5.25
item.description: 戴维-米利肯和苏班-阿卜杜拉报道【原文：By David Milliken and Suban Abdulla】

item.title: 埃森哲预测 2024 年收入增长将高于预期，原因是人工智能需求旺盛
item.description: IT 服务提供商埃森哲周四预计，由于人工智能应用的不断增长抵消了企业支出增长的疲软，该公司的年收入增长将在很大程度上高于预期，从而使其股价在盘前交易中上涨了 3%。【原文：IT services provider Accenture projected annual revenue growth largely above estimates on Thursday, as growing adoption of artificial intelligence offsets sluggish growth in enterprise spending, sending its shares up 3% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：霍尼韦尔斥资 20 亿美元收购航空航天与国防公司 CAES Systems
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四报道，霍尼韦尔已同意以约 20 亿美元的价格从私募股权公司 Advent International 手中收购航空航天与国防技术公司 CAES Systems。【原文：Honeywell has agreed to buy aerospace and defense technology company CAES Systems for roughly $2 billion from private equity firm Advent International, The Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 文件显示，丰田集团供应商电装和爱信缩减交叉持股规模
item.description: 周四的监管文件显示，丰田的两家顶级供应商电装（Denso）和爱信（Aisin）已经出售了在多家丰田关联公司中的持股，这是该庞大汽车集团交叉持股的最新一次减持。【原文：Two of Toyota's top suppliers, Denso and Aisin, have sold off holdings in several Toyota-affiliated companies, regulatory filings showed on Thursday, in the latest reduction of cross-shareholding across the sprawling automotive group.】

item.title: 德国因 "胖手指 "故障对花旗集团处以罚款
item.description: 德国银行监管机构周四表示，花旗集团因交易系统控制失误被处以近 1300 万欧元（约合 1394 万美元）的罚款，这是该机构消费者保护部门做出的有史以来最大的处罚。【原文：Germany has fined Citigroup nearly 13 million euros ($13.94 million) for lapses in its trading system controls, the nation's bank regulator said on Thursday, as its consumer protection division imposed its largest penalty ever.】

item.title: 美国股市上涨，瑞士再次降息，英国央行受到关注；人民币下滑
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】
